name: Appalachia
description: Appalachia is a hybrid cross between Green Crack and Tres Dawg bred by High & Lonesome Seeds. A layer of white, cloudy trichomes gives the buds a sage green color with darker leaves and fiery hairs peeking out from underneath. With an aroma of earthy pine and subtle fruit, Appalachia delivers a dreamy and yet functional cerebral buzz paired with relaxing full-body effects. Sensory perception and appetite are sharpened while pain and other symptoms dull, making Appalachia a coveted strain among medical patients and recreational consumers alike.
descriptionPlain: Appalachia is a hybrid cross between Green Crack and Tres Dawg bred by High & Lonesome Seeds. A layer of white, cloudy trichomes gives the buds a sage green color with darker leaves and fiery hairs peeking out from underneath. With an aroma of earthy pine and subtle fruit, Appalachia delivers a dreamy and yet functional cerebral buzz paired with relaxing full-body effects. Sensory perception and appetite are sharpened while pain and other symptoms dull, making Appalachia a coveted strain among medical patients and recreational consumers alike.

highlightedReviews.text: Well this app does not have my strain so here's the most close to it. "Appalachian Thunderfuck"' ! We all have heard of Alaskan Thunderfuck , but personally I've never heard of this cross. The flowers I have are absolutely beautiful and are incredibly potent. You will be either incredibly lucky or a grower to run across this powerhouse . For sure sativa dominant but wow the indica side creeps up on you within 10 min. If your lucky enough to find this strain pick it up , I'd say very close to what I consider a perfect "high " (60% sativa/40% indica ).

Appalachia grown by Grassroots in Maryland

I was excited to find some of this strain nearby. Pretty dark purple buds with orange hairs and lots of crystals. Very relaxed and happy high. Works well on my pain and puts me in a smiley mood. Nothing bad to say at all. I will surely get some more next time I see it.

articles.title: New Strains: Ancient OG, Appalachia, Lucky Charms, Mother's Finest, and Sunshine Daydream
articles.author: Bailey Rahn
articles.text:
Many of this week’s new strains come at the request of our users, and Leafly strives to target the varieties that are available to you. If you feel that we missed any, let us know! 
Ancient OG and Sunshine Daydream are our new indicas from Bodhi Seeds, and from Sensi Seeds we’ve added their energizing sativa, Mother’s Finest. Looking for something in between? Appalachia and Lucky Charms are the hybrids you’ll want to look out for. If you manage to locate any of these new strains, help our your fellow cannabis enthusiasts by rating and reviewing!
1. Ancient OG
Characteristics of Ancient OG:

Mostly indica strain 
Cross between an Iranian landrace strain and Snow Lotus
Breeder: Bodhi Seeds
Earthy pine and sweet citrus aroma
Indoor flowering time of 70 days; October harvest outdoors

2. Appalachia
Characteristics of Appalachia:

Hybrid strain
Cross between Green Crack and Tres Dawg
Breeder: High & Lonesome Seeds
Earthy pine and subtle fruit aroma
Dreamy and yet functional cerebral buzz paired with relaxing full-body effects
Improves appetite and dulls pain

3. Lucky Charms
Characteristics of Lucky Charms:

50/50 hybrid strain
Cross between The White and Appalachia
Tangy fruit aroma
Indoor flowering time of 9 weeks

4. Mother’s Finest
Characteristics of Mother’s Finest:

70% sativa strain
Heavy Haze genetics
Breeder: Sensi Seeds
Sweet, tangy, earthy aroma
Energetic sativa buzz
Indoor flowering time of 7 to 10 weeks; outdoor harvest at the end of October

5. Sunshine Daydream
Characteristics of Sunshine Daydream:

Indica-dominant strain
Cross between Appalachia and Bubbashine
Breeder: Bodhi Seeds  
Tangy diesel, fruit, and berry flavors
May help pain, nausea, and inflammation
